verses.verse: (Unity Through Humility) Therefore if there is any consolation in Christ, if any comfort of love, if any fellowship of the Spirit, if any (Col. 3:12) affection and mercy,
(John 3:29) fulfill my joy (Rom. 12:16) by being like-minded, having the same love, being of (Phil. 4:2) one accord, of one mind.
(Gal. 5:26; James 3:14) Let nothing be done through selfish ambition or conceit, but (Rom. 12:10; Eph. 5:21) in lowliness of mind let each esteem others better than himself.
(1 Cor. 13:5) Let each of you look out not only for his own interests, but also for the interests of (Rom. 15:1, 2) others.
(The Humbled and Exalted Christ) ((Matt. 11:29); Rom. 15:3) Let this mind be in you which was also in Christ Jesus,
who, (2 Cor. 4:4) being in the form of God, did not consider it robbery to be equal with God,
(Ps. 22:6) but made Himself of no reputation, taking the form (Is. 42:1) of a bondservant, and ((John 1:14); Rom. 8:3; Gal. 4:4; (Heb. 2:17)) coming in the likeness of men.
And being found in appearance as a man, He humbled Himself and (Ps. 40:6-8; Matt. 26:39; John 10:18; (Rom. 5:19)) became (Heb. 5:8) obedient to the point of death, even the death of the cross.
((Matt. 28:18); Heb. 2:9) Therefore God also (Ps. 68:18; 110:1; Is. 52:13; Acts 2:33) has highly exalted Him and (Is. 9:6; Luke 1:32; Eph. 1:21) given Him the name which is above every name,
(Is. 45:23; Rom. 14:11; Rev. 5:13) that at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, of those in heaven, and of those on earth, and of those under the earth,
and (John 13:13; (Rom. 10:9; 14:9)) that every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father.

(Light Bearers) Therefore, my beloved, (Phil. 1:5, 6; 4:15) as you have always obeyed, not as in my presence only, but now much more in my absence, (John 6:27, 29; 2 Pet. 1:10) work out your own salvation with (Eph. 6:5) fear and trembling;
for (Rom. 12:3; 1 Cor. 12:6; 15:10; 2 Cor. 3:5; Heb. 13:20, 21) it is God who works in you both to will and to do (Eph. 1:5) for His good pleasure.
Do all things (1 Cor. 10:10; 1 Pet. 4:9) without complaining and (Rom. 14:1) disputing,
that you may become blameless and harmless, children of God without fault in the midst of a crooked and perverse generation, among whom you shine as (Matt. 5:15, 16) lights in the world,
holding fast the word of life, so that (2 Cor. 1:14) I may rejoice in the day of Christ that (Gal. 2:2) I have not run in vain or labored in (Is. 49:4; Gal. 4:11; 1 Thess. 3:5) vain.

Yes, and if (2 Cor. 12:15; 2 Tim. 4:6) I am being poured out as a drink offering on the sacrifice (Num. 28:6, 7; Rom. 15:16) and service of your faith, (2 Cor. 7:4) I am glad and rejoice with you all.
For the same reason you also be glad and rejoice with me.
(Timothy Commended) But I trust in the Lord Jesus to send (Rom. 16:21) Timothy to you shortly, that I also may be encouraged when I know your state.
For I have no one (1 Cor. 16:10; 2 Tim. 3:10) like-minded, who will sincerely care for your state.
For all seek their own, not the things which are of Christ Jesus.
But you know his proven character, (1 Cor. 4:17) that as a son with his father he served with me in the gospel.
Therefore I hope to send him at once, as soon as I see how it goes with me.
But I trust in the Lord that I myself shall also come shortly.

(Epaphroditus Praised) Yet I considered it necessary to send to you (Phil. 4:18) Epaphroditus, my brother, fellow worker, and (Philem. 2) fellow soldier, (John 13:16; 2 Cor. 8:23) but your messenger and (2 Cor. 11:9) the one who ministered to my need;
(Phil. 1:8) since he was longing for you all, and was distressed because you had heard that he was sick.
For indeed he was sick almost unto death; but God had mercy on him, and not only on him but on me also, lest I should have sorrow upon sorrow.
Therefore I sent him the more eagerly, that when you see him again you may rejoice, and I may be less sorrowful.
Receive him therefore in the Lord with all gladness, and hold such men in esteem;
because for the work of Christ he came close to death, not regarding his life, (1 Cor. 16:17; Phil. 4:10) to supply what was lacking in your service toward me.
